general.headline: Co-founder - COO @Uptale // VR-XR-IMMERSIVE Learning // #Edtech #Worktech //  We‚Äôre Hiring !
general.mutualConnectionsText: Fabrice FEUGAS, raphael attias, and 338 other mutual connections
general.description:
We believe education and learning are the greatest way to drive change and envision a positive future. 
Though, the education ecosystem hasn't been able to evolve as the same pace as technologies and modern way of life. While people have less attention, more mobility and tend to engage only with good content; trainings -especially in the corporate world- are still based on boring powerpoints, poor storytelling and low long-term impact.

For greater impact, we believe the use of technologies in education should address the way brain learns the best by: retaining attention, generating engagement, being playful, being accessible anytime, anywhere.
One rising technology gathers all of these features: Virtual Reality.

Providing greater learning/education through VR is the purpose of our startup called Uptale (www.uptale.io). In other words, we are specialized in Immersive Learning.

We conceive from A to Z real-life gamified learning experiences (simulations, pedagogical visits, "live my life", safety exercices) in 360VR for learning professionals, trainers, consultants, teachers.

The first results obtained with our first clients are stunning:
- 100% attention rate

general.description:
Named as one of Forbes‚Äô 30 Under 30, Camille Rumani is the co-founder of VizEat and the COO of VizEat and Eatwith, the world‚Äôs largest community for culinary experiences. Eatwith connects food-loving hosts with travelers and locals seeking unique, immersive dining experiences, cooking classes, food tours and more. 

A Mandarin speaker, Camille previously lived and worked in Beijing, China. Upon returning to Paris to focus on her three passions, tech, food and travel, Camille co-founded VizEat (now Eatwith) in 2014. 

As a tech pioneer and business innovator, Camille focuses on applying disruptive and scalable techniques to products, procedures and teams. Under her leadership, Eatwith has raised millions in venture capital, lead strategic acquisitions, expanded into 130+ countries, and was awarded ‚ÄúBest App‚Äù in 2017 and 2018 by Apple. Camille manages over 70 employees and contractors in five different countries.

Passionate about empowering women in tech and accelerating start-ups, Camille was the Ambassador for the Young Women in Digital Conference in Paris, and  regularly speaks at conferences such as SXSW, Skift Conference, Station F Founders Program, the Product Con, Apps Days, TBEX Con. and more.
